Master Answer:
Immunization is not mandatory in BC.  However, it is strongly recommended that children are up-to-date with all of their routine immunizations prior to entering school.
Canada's National Advisory Committee on Immunization (NACI) makes recommendations for the use of vaccines currently or newly approved for use in Canada. Following an assessment of recommendations, evidence and local information and data, provinces and territories determine the best schedule for their region. You can find BC's routine immunization schedules for infants & children and school age children here.
- Immunization Nurse
